comments: Number of 4-ary words of length 2n in which the combined count of 0's and 1's is greater than n. - _David Scambler_, Aug 13 2012
references: The right-hand side of a binomial coefficient identity in H. W. Gould, Combinatorial Identities, Morgantown, 1982, (3.98), page 33.
links: H. W. Gould, ed. J. Quaintance, Combinatorial Identities, May 2010, (7.6) p. 35.
formula: a(n) + A045952(n) = 2^(4n). - _David Scambler_, Aug 13 2012a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n-1}(C(4*k+2, 2*k+1) * C(4*n-4*k-2, 2*n-2*k-1)). (LHS of Gould's identity, corrected).a(n) = 2^(4*n-1)*(1-(Gamma(n+1/2))/(sqrt(Pi)*Gamma(n+1))). - Alexander R. Povolotsky, Aug 13 2012a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n-1}(2^(2*n) * C(2*n, k)). - _David Scambler_, Aug 13 2012a(n+2) = (8*(4*n+5)*a(n+1))/(n+2)-(128*(2*n+1)*a(n))/(n+2). - Alexander R. Povolotsky, Aug 14 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 15 2000
